situation: At the end of the day during a busy dismissal, L started crying and trying to block out the noise and crowd.
action: The aide asked L to stand in line with the other children and wait for their guardians, ignoring his plea to sit alone with his noise-canceling headphones.
effect: L’s crying intensified, attracting more attention and increasing his discomfort in the crowded environment.
topic: Sensory Overload Situations - scenarios involving overwhelming sensory inputs like loud noises, bright lights, or crowded spaces
